content.title: Grant-in-aid (TB)
content.department: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
content.beneficiary: Scheduled Tribes and Scheduled Castes persons
content.details: No.G.11012/7/93-HFW dt. 4th June’97: stated that whereas the State Government is of the opinion to make a set of rules for granting financial assistance in the form of Grant-in-Aid to a person having no employment under the Government, Public Sector undertaking or under any local bodies may qualify to receive the grant suffering from fell disease as specified below, the Governor of Mizoram is pleased to make the following rules namely: These rules may be called the Mizoram Health & Family Welfare (Grant-in-Aid to indigent Schedule Tribes and Scheduled Castes patients suffering from fell diseases) Rules 1997. They shall come into force with effect from the date of its publication in the Mizoram Gazette. Scheduled Tribes and Scheduled Castes persons permanently residing within the State of Mizoram none of whose family members are Government employees and whose family income from all sources does not exceed Rs.2000/- per month and suffering from fell diseases are eligible to receive the grant.
benefits: The grant-in-aid shall be given in cash or by means of a Bank Draft.
The grant-in-aid shall be made subject to the availability of funds and cannot be claimed as a matter of right.
The amount of grant-in-aid shall be limited to the actual cost of treatment and fare as per the cheapest route available subject to the maximum of Rs.2500/- per head.
eligibility: Scheduled Tribes and Scheduled Castes persons permanently residing within the State of Mizoram.
None of whose family members are Government employees and whose family income from all sources does not exceed Rs.2000/- per month and who are suffering from fell diseases.
content.application_process: Offline: The application shall be forwarded by the Medical Officer i/c of the locality. The authenticity of the residence of the person shall have to be certified by the Village Council President and Block Development Officer concerned and the Medical Board shall examine the patient and issue certificate accordingly.

faqs.question: What is the maximum amount that will be given to a patient?
faqs.answer: The amount of grant-in-aid shall be limited to the actual cost of treatment and fare as per the cheapest route available subject to the maximum of Rs.2500/- per head.

faqs.question: Are benefits available for Government employees?
faqs.answer: No, benefits are not available for government employees.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to take benefits of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries belonging to Scheduled Tribes and Scheduled Castes and none of the family members should be in Government service.

faqs.question: What should be the income limit?
faqs.answer: Income limit of family should not exceed Rs.2000/-.

faqs.question: What is the mode of Application?
To whom shall the application be forwarded?
faqs.answer: The application must be forwarded to the medical officer.

faqs.question: Who will examine the patient's condition and approve the application?
faqs.answer: Block Development Officer and Medical Board will examine and approve the application of the patient.
